body.p:
Hd Qrts Battery 'E' 1st Ky Light Artillery Vols.
Lexington. Ky. January 26"/65
To His Excellency
T.. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Ky.
Sir,
I have the honor to cheerfully recomend Samuel A. Miller 2nd Lieut of My Battery as worthy of promotion to the 1st Lieutenancy now vacant, occasioned by my promotion to the Captaincy,

He is and has been since I became acquainted with him, (which was when the Battery was organized) one of the most punctual capable and efficient of Officers and I have no hesitancy in saying, he will at all time uphold the honor and credit of his state and country.

I am Sir Very respectfully,
Your most obedient Servt,
L. E. P Bush
Captn Comdg Battery 'E' 1st Ky Light Art Vols.
I heartily Endorse the above recommindation

W. S. Andrews Col &
Chf Artillery Mil. D. Ky.

2 Lieut Samuel A Miller com 1 Lieut Company E. 1 Arty. Jany 26. 1865 vice L. E. P. Bush promos
